title: Magnetic Force Comparison on Spheres 1 and 2

content.question: The figure above shows a uniform magnetic field directed into the page and two spheres that enter the field with velocities in the plane of the page. Sphere <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="Lowercase m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, charge <math alttext="positive q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and is moving to the right. Sphere <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="2 lowercase m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, charge <math alttext="positive 2 q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, speed <math alttext="2 v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and is moving to the left. Which of the following correctly compares the magnitudes of the magnetic forces <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the spheres due to the field?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 2 equals the fraction F sub 1 over 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
